channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: Open kitchen shelves may look great, Marni says, but are they for you?
item.description: I know it’s tempting. You see those clean, uncluttered open shelves in kitchens, with their matching ceramic dishes, beautifully staged glassware, lots of negative space, and you think, “Why not? If my kitchen had open shelving, my belongings would look great, too! Plus, everything would be so easy to reach.”

item.title: Marni's sentimental guide to giving the past a presence in our homes
item.description: Over the years, I have earned the reputation as the stuff police. I am forever nagging you to purge, declutter, toss, donate, edit, dump, oust, clear, lighten up and let go. But today, sit down, I am going to sentimentally suggest that some old things you should keep.

item.title: Walking the rightsizing walk. Here's why I decided to sell the house
item.description: I should know by now, if you venture into an exploratory hypothetical conversation with a real estate broker, you might as well start packing. One casual conversation with a broker friend started the house hurricane.

item.title: Fall time change: Here's when daylight saving time ends…
item.description: The years-long struggle to decidewhether or not to “lock the clock”is continuing in the halls of Congress, meaning as of August 2025, we will still “fall back” in a few months.

item.title: What's the latest path, spaghetti models for Tropical…
item.description: Tropical Storm Erin is expected tobecome a hurricaneFriday, Aug. 15, and then become a "powerful" Category 4 storm within the next three days, according to the latest advisory from theNational Hurricane Center.

item.title: Nonprofit will test for 'forever chemicals' in North Port water
item.description: NORTH PORT –Suncoast Waterkeeper is launching a free water testing programin the city, designed to raise awareness about the presence of “forever chemicals” in water.
